commit_message:
Add watcher parameters settings

Change-Id: Idbc4250d69b6e171970594fa55af7d00b6717e64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-rally refs/changes/25/409625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: rally::settings::watcher # # Configure Rally benchmarking settings for Watcher # # === Parameters # # [*audit_launch_poll_interval*] # (Optional) Watcher audit launch interval # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*audit_launch_timeout*] # (Optional) Watcher audit launch timeout # Defaults to $::os_service_default # class rally::settings::watcher ( $audit_launch_poll_interval = $::os_service_default, $audit_launch_timeout = $::os_service_default, ) { include ::rally::deps rally_config { 'benchmark/watcher_audit_launch_poll_interval': value => $audit_launch_poll_interval; 'benchmark/watcher_audit_launch_timeout': value => $audit_launch_timeout; } }

commit_message:
Transform instance.snapshot notifications

The instance.snapshot.start and instance.snapshot.end notifications
are transformed to the versioned framework.

Change-Id: I0bde5fce14c181d47f5ad052a68382e01bf95524
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-ocata

commit_message:
handle exception when creating nova server.

this patch revise exception handler in do_create(...) method
of creating nova server.

Change-Id: I358cce91454cbaffb95717ac746fd7c73ef449d9

commit_message:
Return 422 exception when querying vertica with wrong timestamp

CLI returns internal server error when input timestamp is in the
wrong format(for example 20160729T12:00:00Z). ISO_8601_FORMATTER
parse the timestamp into 20160729-01-01T12:00:00.000Z in this case.
The internal server error came from vertica when vertica tried to
query with the out of range timestamp. Adding the try catch in
vertica code to return 422 unprocessable_entity instead.

Change-Id: Ie70e8d725ec00a93fb1fb82b8f4e7a24140dcdbb

commit_message:
TEST: Drop redirects and pipes from postci call

Just in case somewhere along the line here we're losing some output
that might be helpful in determining why things are hanging after
postci completes.

Change-Id: I5c8baffc92530ada9426fcf0de422bfb10a1036f

commit_message:
Add keystone v3 login support to integration tests.

This patch adds support of defining a keystone default domain
that has credentials for username/password under it.
The domain concept of keystone v3 was introduced quite long
ago and test suites like tempest already updated the credentials
options to add domain name option.
In addition, tempest also updated test_dashboard_basic_ops.py
to use the domain in login page.
With this patch, that domain support is available for testing
against horizon environment that has keystone V3 only.

Change-Id: I35b72eef78507d2d47fa5fad74640ba49ea81908
Closes-Bug: #1619042

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 20:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/pip-and-virtualenv/install.d/pip-and-virtualenv-source-install/04-install-pip', 'elements/pip-and-virtualenv/README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/280896759a8978900f6b7d95dad9aff92548f146', 'message': "Pip install as 10- incompatible with 05-heat-cfntools

Tripleo-image-elements have an install.d file '05-heat-cfntools' that runs

virtualenv --setuptools $VENV

With the recent change to diskimage-builder (moving the install of pip

commit_message:
Pip install as 10- incompatible with 05-heat-cfntools

Tripleo-image-elements have an install.d file '05-heat-cfntools' that runs
the following command:

virtualenv --setuptools $VENV

With the recent change to diskimage-builder (moving the install of pip
and virtualenv to the 10- range) virtualenv is no longer available for
this elementr; as a side-effect, the trove kick-start command is now
broken and gate jobs are failing.

The solutions is to move the (now) 10-install-pip to 04-install-pip.
This should still alleviate the race condition that
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408277/ attempted to fix, as all
*-package-installs files are 00-, 01- or 02-.

Change-Id: Ia4e01f00c4c5e9a2087df1e2a91d9154480a0422
Closes-Bug: #1650008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/51/410951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Any element that uses these commands must be designated as 05-* or higher to ensure that they are first installed.

commit_message:
DNS fix 3

DNS suddenly started failing on ubuntu again. Seems like ubuntu
unbound got updated and its validation is more strict.

Change-Id: I00358cd45bf0d46e56e5ac29c3933f2146129ba6

commit_message:
db: use neutron_lib.db.model_base

neutron change set of 3b8143bf2d9e95585ec426ffb4e91ba4d7c05107
removed deprecation warning for BASEV2 from neutron.db.model_base.
Update stale import of neutron.db.model_base to
neutron_lib.db.model_base.

Change-Id: I8b80f0d9a22868155755dbe4ae7597dcfe432926

commit_message:
Add oslo_messaging_notifications transport_url

Add the ability to configure the oslo_messaging_notifications
transport_url.

Change-Id: Ied553643acdb180f3c5f742e630256463cd7134d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-congress refs/changes/09/410409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_oslo__messaging__default('congress_config').with(:transport_url => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') } it { is_expected.to contain_oslo__messaging__notification('congress_config').with(:transport_url => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') } context 'with notification_transport_url parameter' do let :params do { :notification_transport_url => 'rabbit://user:pass@host:1234/virtualhost' } end it 'configures rabbit' do is_expected.to contain_oslo__messaging__notification('congress_config').with( :transport_url => 'rabbit://user:pass@host:1234/virtualhost' ) end end

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I3eb965550b53e7cedffc58fddfc8e8cd96b9859f
Closes-Bug: #1628580
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glare refs/changes/11/409611/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shared_examples_for 'glare-dbsync' do it 'runs glare-manage db_sync' do is_expected.to contain_exec('glare-manage db_sync').with( :command => 'glare-db-manage upgrade"', :user => 'glare', :path => [ '/bin/', '/usr/bin/' , '/usr/local/bin' ], :refreshonly => 'true', :try_sleep => 5, :tries => 10, :subscribe => ['Anchor[glare::install::end]', 'Anchor[glare::config::end]', 'Anchor[glare::dbsync::begin]'], :notify => 'Anchor[glare::dbsync::end]', ) describe "overriding extra_params" do let :params do { :extra_params => '--config-file /etc/glare/glare.conf', } end it { is_expected.to contain_exec('glare-manage db_sync').with( :command => 'glare-db-manage --config-file /etc/glare/glare.conf upgrade"', :user => 'glare', :path => [ '/bin/', '/usr/bin/' , '/usr/local/bin' ], :refreshonly => 'true', :try_sleep => 5, :tries => 10, :subscribe => ['Anchor[glare::install::end]', 'Anchor[glare::config::end]', 'Anchor[glare::dbsync::begin]'], :notify => 'Anchor[glare::dbsync::end]', ) } end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge(OSDefaults.get_facts({ :os_workers => 8, :concat_basedir => '/var/lib/puppet/concat' })) end it_configures 'glare-dbsync' end
deleted_lines: context 'exec has proper name' do it { is_expected.to contain_exec('glare-db-sync') } end context 'class sync default command' do it { is_expected.to contain_exec('glare-db-sync').with_command( 'glare-db-manage upgrade') } end context 'class sync work with parameters' do let :params do { :extra_params => '-yyy' } it { is_expected.to contain_exec('glare-db-sync').with_command('glare-db-manage -yyy upgrade') }

commit_message:
Auto reschedule loadbalancers from dead agents

Similarly to what was done in 'allow_automatic_l3agent_failover'
This patch adds a periodic check to examine the status of all LBaaS
agents with loadbalancers scheduled to them.
If the agent is dead, the loadbalancer will be rescheduled to an alive
agent.

The periodic LBaaS agents status check is invoked by
add_agent_status_check_worker() which was introduced in neutron codebase in
I3a32a95489831f0d862930384309eefdc881d8f6 to allow safe process forking.

Closes-Bug: #1565511

Depends-On: I652ab029b7427c8783e4b2f0443a89ee884bf064
Change-Id: Id8d3218bf1e52722cc10ddcd34e3e734eef90658
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/98/299998/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
spec file for ceilometer-measurement-filter

Change-Id: I80c0a4b247993994b18f77c1235b9d86586384a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/30/195030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Example Spec - The title of your blueprint ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/ceilometer-measurement-filter Currently there is no system in ceilometer where we filer as what data get published to the server. either everthing get publishe or nothing get published. there should be some mechanism where user can decide as to what data should get published and what should not this. This feature should enable the user for the same. Problem description =================== All celiometer middleware publish all the the data that goes through the middleware, there could be case where a user may be interested in data that might fullfill certain condition, and they many want to exlude certain data and pass only a specific set of data, it may be related to billing or mesurement. * Use case: Data specific billing, if a cloud operator want to bill for only a certain type of data, it should be stop the data that is not billable for the user * Use case: Domain exclusion, if a operator do not want to collect data from a certain domain, it should be able to filter out that data from that domoin * There should be no major rework, but there will a minor modification in each middleware that may want to take advantage of this feature Proposed change =============== One way to solve this problem will be make a new middleware that will load a list of filter and passing request object to each filter. filter will return either a true value or false, if even one of it return true a header will added in request, the publishing middleware will check for this header if it is present it will stop the publishing. the new middle ware will be independent with it own config other method is to make it a library before pubishing data request should be passed to one exclude function, and function will either return true or false based on the filter that it have run. all the middle ware that want to use this functionalty will have to make changes to check for header or use the library, rest will remain same and there will no change in functinalyt. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- If Middleware approach is taken then we will need to add new app in the pipiline. eles there will be no impact on the pipeline. If other agent approch is taken, there should be no major impact. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- There could be a potential increase in time for API turnaround time. will depend on no of filter and theri runnig time. Other deployer impact --------------------- A new config will be added, for user if they want this feature or not it will be disabled by default, so user will have to enable it. In case user enable it, it will have to add a new config to as what filter they need. there will be some common filter, and a user can add custom one as they need. Developer impact ---------------- The developer of all the celiometer middleware need to be aware of this and should make changes in respective middleware to incorporate this feature in their middleware. this will only provide the framework for filter system The onus of incroporating this feature in each middleware will lie on the developer of the middleware. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Other contributors: None Ongoing maintainer: None Work Items ---------- Devlopment of plugin system. Devlopment of middleware( if middleware approch is taken ) Future lifecycle ================ The members of the Telemetry program will do any required ongoing maintenance for this feature. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= In addition to existing unit tests of the API, the new declarative http tests can be used to confirm that posted samples continue to have expected transformations. Documentation Impact ==================== Deployment documentation may need some slight updates to indicate the change in configuration file for middleware deployment. Also new feature need to documented so that user may use it according to their need. References ========== None.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 12:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/os-lxc-container-setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/8a660f7c2aa1b7ca9a638c9358400df627610d1d', 'message': 'Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa

(cherry picked from commit f219d90d8b85ed2c2c7a3771ee1f8143f1065fa6)

commit_message:
Process and mount default bind mounts first

lxc_default_bind_mounts are now mounted before list_of_bind_mounts.
As a consequence, /var/log/ is now mounted before /var/log/log-storage/
in rsyslog containers.
Also, directory creation inside the container is now handled by LXC
(using the create=dir option) just before the directory gets mounted,
so mounting a subdirectory after a directory (such as
/var/log/log-storage/ and /var/log/) will work.

Change-Id: I29be91b4dca5abe1bb8307429a86c06dbd3ef7aa
Closes-Bug: #1648065
(cherry picked from commit f219d90d8b85ed2c2c7a3771ee1f8143f1065fa6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/68/409768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: line: "lxc.mount.entry = {{ item['mount_path'] }} {{ item['bind_dir_path'].lstrip('/') }} none bind,create=dir 0 0" - "{{ list_of_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" - (_mc is defined and _mc | changed) or (_ec is defined and _ec | changed)
deleted_lines: - "{{ list_of_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" delegate_to: "{{ physical_host }}" when: - not is_metal | bool - name: LXC bind mount directories lxc_container: name: "{{ inventory_hostname }}" container_command: | [[ ! -d "{{ item['bind_dir_path'] }}" ]] && mkdir -p "{{ item['bind_dir_path'] }}" with_items: - "{{ lxc_default_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" register: _bm line: "lxc.mount.entry = {{ item['mount_path'] }} {{ item['bind_dir_path'].lstrip('/') }} none bind 0 0" - "{{ list_of_bind_mounts | default([]) }}" - (_bm is defined and _bm | changed) or (_ec is defined and _ec | changed)

will live in /etc/virtualbmc/virtualbmc.conf. When vbmc does not find a
configuration file in the user directory it will then fallback to the

commit_message:
Add support for a "global" configuration file

Prior to this patch, virutalbmc could only be configured in a per-user
basis. The configuration file as well the path where the VBMCs are going
to be created always lived in the users home directory.

This patch is adding support for a "global" configuration file which
will live in /etc/virtualbmc/virtualbmc.conf. When vbmc does not find a
configuration file in the user directory it will then fallback to the
global (if it exist, otherwise it will just uses the defaults values).

Also, a new configuration option called "config_dir" has been added.
This allows users to configure whatever directory they want to save the
created VirtualBMCs where before it always pointed to ~/.vbmc/config.

Closes-Bug: #1647341
Change-Id: Id8bca620d1543436f32ecc650fc28cbc3f13f373
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/virtualbmc refs/changes/16/406916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change fixtures to use https

It's not REAL traffic, but shade upgrades connections to https in some
places where half of the config erroneously shows http, so it's good to
have the fixtures look correct.

commit_message:
Honor image_api_version when doing version discovery

We want to grab the latest version available - unless the user has
configured themselves to request a previous version. Enter Cloud Suite
is an example of a cloud that has v2 but v1 must be used for uploads.

Change-Id: I1603fd567a59b5c123ab2f84c7a9571381245e97

commit_message:
Fix ipv6 transport failure caused by Ryu 4.9 and above

The api of neighbor_add has been changed in version 4.9 of Ryu.
It will let ipv6 transport in neutron-dynamic-routing fail.

In the previous version, a capability for address family is set
automatically from result of parsing address parameter in Ryu.
In the new version, the capability for ipv6 needs to be explicitly
specified by enable_ipv6 parameter.
This adds to parse an address in ryu driver in dragent.

Depends-On: Iae040244fd38a8e2a8f6278b07334739e6700f1f
Change-Id: I9eafc04a0a4ee651de0376f6cc98957a8a58eaf4

commit_message:
Always title-case headers on the way out of gatekeeper

Middleware may disable this per-header by emitting a header like

    X-Backend-Gatekeeper-Preserve-Casing: header1, HEADER2

Change-Id: I39780e667960c41dde2712d19383fc8f30b9ba24

  py35 jobs are run as non-voting

- Is the library license compatible?
  Apache-2.0, so Yes.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?
  No, not yet.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
  Nope.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?
  All that use constraints support. this way we can stage potentially
  incompatible changes happening in a new openstack-requirements
  release.

Change-Id: I59fe12a867b0a25984870db991e18b5b197da173
'}]
commit_message:
Add openstack-requirements

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes. :-)

- Is the library good code?
  OpenStack standards, so yes

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  py35 jobs are run as non-voting

- Is the library license compatible?
  Apache-2.0, so Yes.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?
  No, not yet.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?
  Nope.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?
  All that use constraints support. this way we can stage potentially
  incompatible changes happening in a new openstack-requirements
  release.

Change-Id: I59fe12a867b0a25984870db991e18b5b197da173

commit_message:
Replace swift capabilities call with REST

This is the first step of removing swiftclient.

Change-Id: I50dd5d262d8ecea02e49aeef087a13fde9604502
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/65/408865/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _object_store_client(self): if 'object-store' not in self._raw_clients: raw_client = self._get_raw_client('object-store') self._raw_clients['object-store'] = raw_client return self._raw_clients['object-store'] @property # The endpoint in the catalog has version and project-id in it # To get capabilities, we have to disassemble and reassemble the URL # This logic is taken from swiftclient endpoint = urllib.parse.urlparse( self._object_store_client.get_endpoint()) url = "{scheme}://{netloc}/info".format( scheme=endpoint.scheme, netloc=endpoint.netloc) return self._object_store_client.get(url) except OpenStackCloudHTTPError as e: if e.response.status_code in (404, 412): raise
deleted_lines: return self.manager.submit_task(_tasks.ObjectCapabilities()) except swift_exceptions.ClientException as e: if e.http_status == 404 or e.http_status == 412: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Could not determine capabilities")

subject: Git checkout more forcefully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 15:20:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/8c34770ae92c2f714ee4a3f6ce6c7e76985e91ff', 'message': 'Git reset before checkout

Since Git can sometimes pre-stage changes in the worktree, for
example to bring local copies of files into alignment with
assertions in the .gitattributes file, do an initial git reset
--hard before attempting to perform a checkout to avoid failures
like, "error: Your local changes to the following files would be
overwritten by checkout..."

Change-Id: Idae869b4d6b7fb2059881c86769bcea1c0f9ae95
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-14 15:31:45.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/0fb8e3696a719e7673890900983fd48105b0dc99', 'message': 'Git checkout more forcefully

Since Git can sometimes pre-stage changes in the worktree, for
example to bring local copies of files into alignment with
assertions in the .gitattributes file, use the -f flag with
git checkout to discard such local changes and avoid failures
like, "error: Your local changes to the following files would be
overwritten by checkout..."

Change-Id: Idae869b4d6b7fb2059881c86769bcea1c0f9ae95
'}]
commit_message:
Git checkout more forcefully

Since Git can sometimes pre-stage changes in the worktree, for
example to bring local copies of files into alignment with
assertions in the .gitattributes file, use the -f flag with
git checkout to discard such local changes and avoid failures
like, "error: Your local changes to the following files would be
overwritten by checkout..."

Change-Id: Idae869b4d6b7fb2059881c86769bcea1c0f9ae95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/10/410810/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Sometimes Git can pre-stage changes, for example via .gitattributes git reset --hard

commit_message:
Text and checkbox should align in "Create Project" form

The "Enabled" text and the checkbox are aligned in "Create Project" form.

Change-Id: If6b587666b9344816cc02cf5519cb144c780597d

commit_message:
Update notifications specs

This updates captures some of the discussions happened recently
around notifications, and why they are designed the way we have
in code currently.

Change-Id: I4994bd583c07e4b623492fffa9754256a4fb772b

deleted_lines: * "success" will be used when an action that is immediate succeeds.

commit_message:
Expand feature classification matrix with gate checks

Added/modified following gate checks to the matrix and added
deployment rating by cross validating it with feature support
matrix[1] and tempest tests.
  1.libvirt+kvm (x86 & ppc64)
  2.libvirt+kvm (s390x)
  3.libvirt+virtuozzo CT
  4.libvirt+virtuozzo VM

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html

Change-Id: I99377ba399ce43151e9fbc525b9afcbc488bba36
Implements: blueprint feature-classification-ocata

subject: Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 11:01:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ceee5e82732fff1d61af24d93b75651d3b61a210', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-09 08:02:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/326385f193a452a8bba9cdfd6c393bfe9c3bdcbe', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-30 11:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/574e048212499a742dfc85338bc1262020e09eb2', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

This patch introduce a new syntax for the address key:
    "address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>,
		"slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }

Example for the regular expression syntax:

    This allows allocation of VFs whose functions are from 2 upwards:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "01",
                                           "function": "[2-7]"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

    This allows allocation of VFs whose slots are between 1 and 2:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "0[1-2]",
                                           "function": ".*"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-30 13:08:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5c6f6f964df1b2a546349976e0cc471b8ad0ebab', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

This patch introduce a new syntax for the address key:
    "address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>,
		"slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }

Example for the regular expression syntax:

    This allows allocation of VFs whose functions are from 2 upwards:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "01",
                                           "function": "[2-7]"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

    This allows allocation of VFs whose slots are between 1 and 2:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "0[1-2]",
                                           "function": ".*"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-31 06:43:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/535676c287d7386ce1d798f6f07b1f8fce0d8464', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

This patch introduce a new syntax for the address key:
    "address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>,
		"slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }

Example for the regular expression syntax:

    This allows allocation of VFs whose functions are from 2 upwards:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "01",
                                           "function": "[2-7]"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

    This allows allocation of VFs whose slots are between 1 and 2:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "0[1-2]",
                                           "function": ".*"},

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-08-02 12:42:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5799d7fd81d4d75d7b571c120d87bde21b8a1964', 'message': 'Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

This patch introduce a new syntax for the address key:
    "address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>,
		"slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }

Example for the regular expression syntax:

    This allows allocation of VFs whose functions are from 2 upwards:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "01",
                                           "function": "[2-7]"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

    This allows allocation of VFs whose slots are between 1 and 2:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "0[1-2]",
                                           "function": ".*"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9

commit_message:
Enhance PCI passthrough whitelist to support regex

This patch introduces a new syntax for the address key:
    "address":{ "domain": <regex_domain>, "bus": <regex_bus>,
                "slot": <regex_slot>, "function": <regex_function> }

Example for the regular expression syntax:

    This allows allocation of VFs whose functions are from 2 upwards:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "01",
                                           "function": "[2-7]"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

    This allows allocation of VFs whose slots are between 1 and 2:
    pci_passthrough_whitelist= {"address":{"domain": ".*",
                                           "bus": "02", "slot": "0[1-2]",
                                           "function": ".*"},
                                "physical_network":"net1"}

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex

Co-Authored-By: Edan David <edand@mellanox.com>

Change-Id: I9a110fb7907415a542d992d98ca7956148d2cbd9

commit_message:
Enable n-novnc service

The service n-novnc is not enabled by default.  This will enable it,
allowing tests associated with NoVNC to be executed. This also
specifies to install noVNC from packages instead of git cloning it
for gate jobs.

Change-Id: I09aed8de28f1ba2637382e870134ced38808df29

commit_message:
Skipping tests for location 'add', 'replace' on 'queued' images

Two of test cases added for the changes [1] and [2]
have been failing, throwing a webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest due to the
fake store url "http://storeurl.com/container/fake_location_1"
being used by both the failing test cases.
The faking in these tests seem to override the usage of
FakseStoreApi and instead call glance_store.

Since, the 2 tests that are failing are caused due to issues
with the faking and not due to the changes [1] and [2] itself,
for which they were added, this patch proposes to skip the
2 failing tests until they are resolved inorder to prevent
other changes from getting blocked.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366995/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324012/

Refrence Bug: #1649300

Change-Id: Ib70ce08528ef92d5fb488e4deb5fe82a7f74a634

commit_message:
Add rally hook to neutron devstack plugin

This allows us to configure neutron when running the rally job in
the gate. This effort stems from patch [1]. Blame Kevin for not
wanting to squash the two together.

[1] I12aaf6121b677e9696131601b3539a7091e2858c
Change-Id: I006957784ac7900021bcfee57cbc83b5a6c533c4

commit_message:
Add a trunk rally test

This adds a basic rally scenario to create a trunk
with a bunch of subports so we can keep an eye on the
performance of the trunk API.

Change-Id: I12aaf6121b677e9696131601b3539a7091e2858c

commit_message:
restore locking in notification tests

The notification samples tests are mocking out locking entirely, which
means that all code using locking for safety no longer is. As this is
spawning services that talk over the oslo.message fake bus, this seems
like a bad idea.

Change-Id: Icdb9e77a1be3efc0068bd1add1d3c72d44183329
Related-Bug: #1649403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/409951/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make bootstrap idempotent when it needs to be

This commit makes `keystone-manage bootstrap` completely idempotent
when configuration values or environment variables haven't changed
between runs. If they have changed, then `bootstrap` shouldn't be
as idempotent becuase it's changing the state of the deployment.

This commit addresses these issues and adds tests to ensure the
proper behavior is tested.

Change-Id: I053b27e881f5bb67db1ace01e6d06aead10b1e47
Closes-Bug: 1647800
(cherry picked from commit 90f2f96e69b8bfd5058628b50c9f0083e3f293e9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/35/408835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_bootstrap_is_idempotent_when_password_does_not_change(self): # NOTE(morganfainberg): Ensure we can run bootstrap with the same # configuration multiple times without erroring. request = self.make_request(is_admin=True) # Make sure the token we authenticate for is still valid. v3_token_controller.validate_token(request) def test_bootstrap_is_not_idempotent_when_password_does_change(self): # NOTE(lbragstad): Ensure bootstrap isn't idempotent when run with # different arguments or configuration values. bootstrap = cli.BootStrap() self._do_test_bootstrap(bootstrap) v3_token_controller = controllers.Auth() v3_password_data = { 'identity': { "methods": ["password"], "password": { "user": { "name": bootstrap.username, "password": bootstrap.password, "domain": { "id": CONF.identity.default_domain_id } } } } } auth_response = v3_token_controller.authenticate_for_token( self.make_request(), v3_password_data) token = auth_response.headers['X-Subject-Token'] os.environ['OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD'] = uuid.uuid4().hex self._do_test_bootstrap(bootstrap) # build validation request request = self.make_request(is_admin=True) request.context_dict['subject_token_id'] = token # Since the user account was recovered with a different password, we # shouldn't be able to validate this token. Bootstrap should have # persisted a revocation event because the user's password was updated. # Since this token was obtained using the original password, it should # now be invalid.
deleted_lines: def test_bootstrap_is_idempotent(self): # NOTE(morganfainberg): Ensure we can run bootstrap multiple times # without erroring. request = self.make_request( is_admin=True, headers={ 'X-Subject-Token': token, 'X-Auth-Token': token } ) # NOTE(lbragstad): This is currently broken because the bootstrap # operation will automatically reset a user's password even if it is # the same as it was before. Bootstrap has this behavior so it's # possible to recover admin accounts, which was one of our main # usecases for introducing the bootstrap functionality. The side-effect # is that changing the password will create a revocation event. So if a # token is obtained in-between two bootstrap calls, the token will no # longer be valid after the second bootstrap operation completes, even # if the password is the same.

subject: Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 22:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/0d9a51ea7719afe95c754cbf4efba4621e6a58e6', 'message': "Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap

During some upgrade testing I was doing locally, I noticed an issue
where `keystone-manage bootstrap` isn't completely idempotent. This
is because `bootstrap` has the ability to recover lost admin accounts
by reseting the admin user's enabled status and updating their
password, regardless of it being different. This creates a revocation
event and causes admin tokens to be invalid after bootstrap is run
for a second time, making it not as idempotent as we'd like.

This commit introduces a test that exposes this behavior.

Change-Id: I627255b2b5d6ec401af2c07c4018930fea206e4a

(cherry picked from commit 2dae412940105c64c4ea1ed77e6a45793faa0efa)

commit_message:
Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap

During some upgrade testing I was doing locally, I noticed an issue
where `keystone-manage bootstrap` isn't completely idempotent. This
is because `bootstrap` has the ability to recover lost admin accounts
by reseting the admin user's enabled status and updating their
password, regardless of it being different. This creates a revocation
event and causes admin tokens to be invalid after bootstrap is run
for a second time, making it not as idempotent as we'd like.

This commit introduces a test that exposes this behavior.

Change-Id: I627255b2b5d6ec401af2c07c4018930fea206e4a
Partial-Bug: 1647800
(cherry picked from commit 2dae412940105c64c4ea1ed77e6a45793faa0efa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/34/408834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.auth import controllers v3_token_controller = controllers.Auth() v3_password_data = { 'identity': { "methods": ["password"], "password": { "user": { "name": bootstrap.username, "password": bootstrap.password, "domain": { "id": CONF.identity.default_domain_id } } } } } auth_response = v3_token_controller.authenticate_for_token( self.make_request(), v3_password_data) token = auth_response.headers['X-Subject-Token'] # build validation request request = self.make_request( is_admin=True, headers={ 'X-Subject-Token': token, 'X-Auth-Token': token } ) request.context_dict['subject_token_id'] = token # NOTE(lbragstad): This is currently broken because the bootstrap # operation will automatically reset a user's password even if it is # the same as it was before. Bootstrap has this behavior so it's # possible to recover admin accounts, which was one of our main # usecases for introducing the bootstrap functionality. The side-effect # is that changing the password will create a revocation event. So if a # token is obtained in-between two bootstrap calls, the token will no # longer be valid after the second bootstrap operation completes, even # if the password is the same. self.assertRaises( exception.TokenNotFound, v3_token_controller.validate_token, request )

commit_message:
Let nova-manage cell_v2 commands use transport_url from CONF

The nova-manage cell_v2 simple_cell_setup command currently requires
a --transport-url to be passed on the command line. It should be
able to use the [DEFAULT]/transport_url setting from nova.conf if
present.

This makes --transport-url optional and uses it if specified. If not
specified, it looks at [DEFAULT]/transport_url, and finally raises
an error if neither were found.

Change-Id: Idfda66d161545a20f3102c083a7198720bf54e6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/409970/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # TODO(melwitt): Remove this when the oslo.messaging function # for assembling a transport url from ConfigOpts is available @args('--transport-url', metavar='<transport url>', required=True, dest='transport_url', def simple_cell_setup(self, transport_url): transport_url = CONF.transport_url or transport_url

commit_message:
Handle maximum limit in schema for int and float type parameters

Create/update inventory APIs returns 500 error if you pass value
greater than db.MAX_INT (2147483647) for total, reserved, min_unit,
max_unit, step_size int type parameters and db.SQL_SP_FLOAT_MAX
(3.40282e+38) for allocation_ratio.

Added maximum limit check in schema to ensure value is not greater than
maximum limit permitted by db for all mentioned parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1642484
Change-Id: I5b8c3c175ca617ae7bb82b81b0fe608ae1755b72

commit_message:
Removed unused ComputeNode create/update_inventory methods

These were made unused with 9dcf0236b4d061027211746cd64ad65b1b27107c
in Newton and can be removed as they are not remotable and nothing
else is calling them.

Part of blueprint generic-resource-pools-ocata

Change-Id: Ia439a5e010a174e75cab05d2ccf7719e679b4fb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/92/407692/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from oslo_db import exception as db_excfrom nova.i18n import _LW def update_inventory(self): """Update inventory records from legacy model values.""" inventory_list = \ objects.InventoryList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid( self._context, self.uuid) if not inventory_list: return False for inventory in inventory_list: if inventory.resource_class == fields.ResourceClass.VCPU: key = 'vcpus' elif inventory.resource_class == fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB: key = 'memory_mb' elif inventory.resource_class == fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB: key = 'local_gb' else: LOG.warning(_LW('Unknown inventory class %s for compute node'), inventory.resource_class) continue if key in self.obj_what_changed(): inventory.total = getattr(self, key) inventory.save() return True def _ensure_resource_provider(self): shortname = self.host.split('.')[0] rp_name = 'compute-%s-%s' % (shortname, self.uuid) rp = objects.ResourceProvider( context=self._context, uuid=self.uuid, name=rp_name) try: rp.create() except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry: rp = objects.ResourceProvider.get_by_uuid(self._context, self.uuid) if rp.name != rp_name: rp.name = rp_name rp.save() return rp def create_inventory(self): """Create the initial inventory objects for this compute node. This is only ever called once, either for the first time when a compute is created, or after an upgrade where the required services have reached the required version. """ rp = self._ensure_resource_provider() cpu = objects.Inventory(context=self._context, resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=self.vcpus, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=1, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=self.cpu_allocation_ratio) cpu.create() mem = objects.Inventory(context=self._context, resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, total=self.memory_mb, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=1, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=self.ram_allocation_ratio) mem.create() # FIXME(danms): Eventually we want to not write this record # if the compute host is on shared storage. We'll need some # indication from it to that effect, so for now we always # write it so that we can make all the usual machinery depend # on these records instead of the legacy columns. disk = objects.Inventory(context=self._context, resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=self.local_gb, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=1, step_size=1, allocation_ratio=self.disk_allocation_ratio) disk.create()

commit_message:
Add support for diskimage-builder tracing

Dib supports a -x argument to output additional tracing information.
Lets support this in our diskimage-create script.

Change-Id: Ifb9f29250475d53ae8c64deef4be01ef8bd584d4

Fix bifrost install playbook README: default value

The enable_inspector default value is true though the README says the default
is false. This patch fixes the README.

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems(iter) with iter.items()

As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems(iter) to
achieve iterators. We can use iter.items() instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ieadd5fa69b3f6058c0641a5b96ef3e8e1e3f6cc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/15/409615/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key, val in values.items():
deleted_lines: import six for key, val in six.iteritems(values):

commit_message:
Add origin to stable branch checkout procedure

The checkout procedure for a stable branch requires 'origin' in the
path. This change makes it possible to cut and paste the charm-guide
only requiring a change to the bug number and the stable version on the
CLI.

Change-Id: I3c45db9e53f8e97c0f3cf39ef190e77b86d2c647
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/18/410318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: git checkout -b stable/bug/XXXX origin/stable/YYYY

commit_message:
Stop caching devstack packages

After talking with clarkb, we decided it might be time to also stop
caching packages for devstack. Like the cache-bindep patch before, we
have a robust mirror infra in place right now, and believe we are
ready to start using it more.

Change-Id: I249f21a98fea3b963b7ffb8e3d0fce02cc540d46
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Retry up to 3 times on disk create

Exceptions can occur while downloading an image from glance, such
as a checksum error or losing connection to the glance server.
Retrying can resolve these issues so we will retry creating the
disk image up to 3 times for a total of 4 attempts.

Close-bug: 1648581
Change-Id: Iac0ef37efb9594c7f087447f86ccb5da38796853

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.vmware.

Change-Id: I6d20d90191f5b0e9dce17affd7aca40081cf7cc7

commit_message:
Let OneViewManage.validate raise OneViewError

The method deploy_utils.is_node_in_use_by_ironic in Ironic OneView
Driver may raise an exception of the type exception.OneViewError,
this exception is not an exception.InvalidParameterValue. Therefore,
it should not be handled that way, but instead to be handled as
exception.OneViewError.

Change-Id: Ic488a9f9977a55c2dff8248130f0a507503427cf
Closes-Bug: 1642266

commit_message:
Collapse keystone2 and nova-net shade jobs

Both are there so that we can test old deprecated but still existing
things. There's no need to test those configs separately.

Change-Id: I675809b8a1f51eb74bc3749d94691b1d5da71ba3

commit_message:
Enable keystone-v2 for shade keystone-v2 job

Also, move it to stable/newton and xenial nodes, since liberty isn't a
thing anymore.

Change-Id: I9391dc353a97afb503362cfa05ac226350e39352

commit_message:
Implemented wacther decision engine config module

Implemented wacther decision engine config module

Partially Implements: blueprint centralise-config-opts

Change-Id: Ie4e9dd7d902fa85044d1859974cbd75d54c8b6cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/06/401006/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import watcher.conf CONF = watcher.conf.CONF
deleted_lines: from oslo_config import cfg CONF = cfg.CONF WATCHER_DECISION_ENGINE_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('conductor_topic', default='watcher.decision.control', help='The topic name used for ' 'control events, this topic ' 'used for RPC calls'), cfg.ListOpt('notification_topics', default=['versioned_notifications', 'watcher_notifications'], help='The topic names from which notification events ' 'will be listened to'), cfg.StrOpt('publisher_id', default='watcher.decision.api', help='The identifier used by the Watcher ' 'module on the message broker'), cfg.IntOpt('max_workers', default=2, required=True, help='The maximum number of threads that can be used to ' 'execute strategies'), ] decision_engine_opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='watcher_decision_engine', title='Defines the parameters of ' 'the module decision engine') CONF.register_group(decision_engine_opt_group) CONF.register_opts(WATCHER_DECISION_ENGINE_OPTS, decision_engine_opt_group)

commit_message:
Add the acceptance test to deploy the cloudkitty service

1) Already have the cloudkitty package in RedHat system, so we can
   add the acceptance test to deploy the service now.
2) Add auth_section and keystone_version in group "keystone_fetcher"
   to load plugin specific options and use specific keystone version.
3) Change the collector valume to 'ceilometer' by default
4) Update releated to test.

Change-Id: Ic2f8fafba1664273d89bd706768416da4d9b93e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cloudkitty refs/changes/93/409693/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper_acceptance' describe 'basic cloudkitty' do context 'default parameters' do it 'should work with no errors' do pp= <<-EOS include ::openstack_integration include ::openstack_integration::repos include ::openstack_integration::rabbitmq include ::openstack_integration::mysql include ::openstack_integration::keystone rabbitmq_user { 'cloudkitty': admin => true, password => 'an_even_bigger_secret', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_user_permissions { 'cloudkitty@/': configure_permission => '.*', write_permission => '.*', read_permission => '.*', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } # Cloudkitty resources case $::osfamily { 'Debian': { warning('Cloudkitty is not yet packaged on Debian systems.') } 'RedHat': { class { '::cloudkitty': default_transport_url => 'rabbit://cloudkitty:an_even_bigger_secret@127.0.0.1:5672', } class { '::cloudkitty::keystone::auth': password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::cloudkitty::keystone::authtoken': password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::cloudkitty::db::mysql': password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::cloudkitty::db': database_connection => 'mysql+pymysql://cloudkitty:a_big_secret@127.0.0.1/cloudkitty?charset=utf8', } class { '::cloudkitty::logging': debug => true, } class { '::cloudkitty::api': } class { '::cloudkitty::processor': } class { '::cloudkitty::client': } } default: { fail("Unsupported osfamily (${::osfamily})") } } EOS # Run it twice and test for idempotency apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) end if os[:family].casecmp('RedHat') == 0 describe port(8889) do it { is_expected.to be_listening } end end end end

commit_message:
Add QNAP ES Storage Driver

This driver supports below features:
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia3e3dc677e1d17a8e3ffbab1f6c0ecb9bb154c9f
Implements: blueprint qnap-cinder-driver

""" # import sys import base64 import functools # import random # import re import six # import string # import oslo # import json import ssl try: import xml.etree.cElementTree as ET except ImportError: import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET # from oslo.config import cfg from oslo_config import cfg try: from cinder.openstack.common import log as logging except ImportError: from oslo_log import log as logging # from oslo.utils import units # from oslo.utils import timeutils from oslo_utils import timeutils from six.moves import http_client from six.moves import urllib # from suds import client from cinder import db from cinder import exception from cinder.i18n import _, _LE, _LI from cinder.volume.drivers.san import san # from cinder.volume import volume_types # from datetime import datetime DRIVER_VERSION = '1.0.0' GB = 1024 * 1024 * 1024 LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) qnap_opts = [ # cfg.StrOpt('san_ip', # default='10.77.201.65', # help='Management IP address for QNAP storage'), cfg.StrOpt('qnap_server_port', default='8080', help='Management Port for QNAP storage'), cfg.StrOpt('qnap_storage_protocol', default='iscsi', help='Communication protocol to access QNAP storage'), cfg.StrOpt('iscsi_ip', default='10.77.201.66', help='iSCSI data port IP for QNAP storage'), # cfg.StrOpt('san_login', # default='admin', # help=('Authorized account to login QNAP storage')), # cfg.StrOpt('san_password', # default=None, # help=('Password to login QNAP storage')), cfg.StrOpt('qnap_poolname', default='pool1', help='The pool name in the QNAP Storage'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(qnap_opts) class QnapDriverException(exception.VolumeDriverException): message = _("QNAP Cinder Driver exception") class QnapAPIException(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException): message = _("Unexpected response from QNAP API") class QnapAPIExpiredException(exception.VolumeBackendAPIException): message = _("Session ID expired for QNAP API") class QnapISCSIDriver(san.SanISCSIDriver): """OpenStack driver to enable QNAP Storage. Version history: 1.0.0 - Initial driver (Only iSCSI) """ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(QnapISCSIDriver, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.APIExecutor = None self.group_stats = {} self.configuration.append_config_values(qnap_opts) def _check_config(self): """Ensure that the flags we care about are set.""" required_config = ['san_ip', 'qnap_server_port', 'iscsi_ip', 'san_login', 'san_password'] for attr in required_config: if not getattr(self.configuration, attr, None): raise exception.InvalidInput(reason=_('%s is not set.') % attr) def do_setup(self, context): """Setup the QNAP Cinder volume driver.""" self._check_config() self.ctxt = context # Setup API Executor try: self.APIExecutor = QnapAPIExecutor( username=self.configuration.san_login, password=self.configuration.san_password, ip=self.configuration.san_ip, port=self.configuration.qnap_server_port) except Exception: LOG.error(_LE('Failed to create HTTP client.' 'Check ip, port, username, password' ' and make sure the array version is compatible')) raise def create_volume(self, volume): """Create a new volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('in create_volume')) reserve = not self.configuration.san_thin_provision self.APIExecutor._execute_create_vol(volume, self.configuration.qnap_poolname, reserve) createdLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) LUNNAA = createdLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), LUNNAA) _metadata = {'LUNNAA': LUNNAA} db.volume_metadata_update(self.ctxt, volume['id'], _metadata, False) def delete_volume(self, volume): """Delete the specified volume.""" ''' if volume['display_name'] is not None: self.APIExecutor.delete_vol(volume['display_name']) else: display_name = ('QCD-' + volume['name'][7:].replace('-', ''))[0:31] self.APIExecutor.delete_vol(display_name) ''' vol_metadata = self.get_volume_metadata(volume['id']) LOG.info(_LI('vol_metadata: %s'), vol_metadata) LOG.info(_LI('len(vol_metadata): %d'), len(vol_metadata)) if len(vol_metadata) != 0: lun_naa = vol_metadata['LUNNAA'] LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), lun_naa) else: try: createdLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) lun_naa = createdLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), lun_naa) _metadata = {'LUNNAA': lun_naa} db.volume_metadata_update(self.ctxt, volume['id'], _metadata, False) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI('Volume is invalid')) # raise QnapDriverException(_('Volume is invalid')) try: delLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNNAA = lun_naa) LUNIndex = delLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) self.APIExecutor.delete_vol(LUNIndex) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI('Volume is invalid')) # raise QnapDriverException(_('Volume is invalid')) def get_volume_metadata(self, volume_id): return self.db.volume_metadata_get(self.ctxt, volume_id) def create_cloned_volume(self, volume, src_vref): """Create a clone of the specified volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('Entering create_cloned_volume...')) ''' # Below is to clone a volume by vss snapshot lun srcLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = src_vref['display_name']) LUNNAA = srcLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info('LUNNAA: %s ', LUNNAA) ret = self.APIExecutor.createVssSnapshot(0, LUNNAA) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) SnapLUNNAA = root.find('snapshot_NAA').text LOG.info(_LI('SnapLUNNAA: %s'), SnapLUNNAA) if (volume['size'] > src_vref['size']): selectedLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNNAA = SnapLUNNAA) LUNIndex = selectedLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info('LUNIndex: %s ', LUNIndex) LUNName = selectedLun.find('LUNName').text LOG.info('LUNName: %s ', LUNName) self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex) ''' # Below is to clone a volume from a snapshot in the snapshot manager srcLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = src_vref['display_name']) LUNIndex = srcLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) ret = self.APIExecutor.createSnapshot(LUNIndex, volume['display_name']) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) snapshot_id = root.find('SnapshotInfo').find('snapshot_id').text LOG.info(_LI('snapshot_id: %s'), snapshot_id) ret = self.APIExecutor.cloneSnapshot(snapshot_id, volume['display_name']) if (volume['size'] > src_vref['size']): selectedLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) LUNIndex = selectedLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) LUNName = selectedLun.find('LUNName').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNName: %s'), LUNName) # self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex) LUNThinAllocate = selectedLun.find('LUNThinAllocate').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNThinAllocate: %s'), LUNThinAllocate) self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex, LUNThinAllocate) def create_export(self, context, volume): """Driver entry point to get the export info for a new volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('In create_export')) model_update = volume['provider_location'] LOG.info(_LI('model_update: %s'), model_update) LOG.info(_LI('Create export done from Volume %(volume_id)s.'), { 'volume_id': volume['id']}) return {'provider_location': model_update} def ensure_export(self, context, volume): """Driver entry point to get the export info for an existing volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('In ensure_export')) def create_snapshot(self, snapshot): """Create a snapshot.""" LOG.info(_LI('Entering create_snapshot snapshot=%(snap)s'), {'snap': snapshot.volume.display_name}) ''' # Below is to create vss snapshot lun srcLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = snapshot.volume.display_name) LUNNAA = srcLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info('LUNNAA: %s ', LUNNAA) ret = self.APIExecutor.createVssSnapshot(0, LUNNAA) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) SnapLUNNAA = root.find('snapshot_NAA').text LOG.info(_LI('SnapLUNNAA: %s'), SnapLUNNAA) _metadata = {'SnapLUNNAA': SnapLUNNAA, 'SrcLUNName': snapshot.volume.display_name} db.snapshot_metadata_update(self.ctxt, snapshot['id'], _metadata, False) ''' # Below is to create snapshot in the snapshot manager vol_metadata = self.get_volume_metadata(snapshot.volume.id) if len(vol_metadata) != 0: lun_naa = vol_metadata['LUNNAA'] LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), lun_naa) else: createdLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = snapshot.volume.display_name) lun_naa = createdLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), lun_naa) _metadata = {'LUNNAA': lun_naa} db.volume_metadata_update(self.ctxt, snapshot.volume.id, _metadata, False) try: srcLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNNAA = lun_naa) LUNIndex = srcLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) mod_snapshot = snapshot['display_name'].replace(" ", "-") LOG.info(_LI('snapshot[display_name]2: %s'), mod_snapshot) ret = self.APIExecutor.createSnapshot(LUNIndex, mod_snapshot) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) snapshot_id = root.find('SnapshotInfo').find('snapshot_id').text LOG.info(_LI('snapshot_id: %s'), snapshot_id) _metadata = {'snapshot_id': snapshot_id} db.snapshot_metadata_update(self.ctxt, snapshot['id'], _metadata, False) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI('Volume is invalid')) ''' if snapshot.volume.display_name is not None: srcLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = snapshot.volume.display_name) else: new_volname = ('QCD-' + snapshot.volume.name[7:]. replace('-', ''))[0:31] srcLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNName = new_volname) LUNIndex = srcLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info('LUNIndex: %s ', LUNIndex) LOG.info('snapshot[name]: %s ', snapshot['name']) LOG.info('snapshot[display_name]1: %s ', snapshot['display_name']) mod_snapshot = snapshot['display_name'].replace(" ", "-") LOG.info('snapshot[display_name]2: %s ', mod_snapshot) #ret = self.APIExecutor.createSnapshot(LUNIndex, snapshot['display_name']) ret = self.APIExecutor.createSnapshot(LUNIndex, mod_snapshot) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) snapshot_id = root.find('SnapshotInfo').find('snapshot_id').text LOG.info(_LI('snapshot_id: %s'), snapshot_id) _metadata = {'snapshot_id': snapshot_id} db.snapshot_metadata_update(self.ctxt, snapshot['id'], _metadata, False) ''' def delete_snapshot(self, snapshot): """Delete a snapshot.""" LOG.info(_LI('Entering delete_snapshot snapshot name=%(name)s ' 'volume_name=%(volname)s'), {'name': snapshot.name, 'volname': snapshot.volume_name}) ''' # Below is to delete vss snapshot lun snap_metadata = self.get_snapshot_metadata(snapshot['id']) try: SrcLUNName = snap_metadata['SrcLUNName'] SnapLUNNAA = snap_metadata['SnapLUNNAA'] LOG.info(_LI('SrcLUNName=%(SrcLUNName)s, SnapLUNNAA=%(SnapLUNNAA)s'), {'SrcLUNName': SrcLUNName, 'SnapLUNNAA': SnapLUNNAA}) self.APIExecutor.deleteVssSnapshot(0, SnapLUNNAA) except Exception: LOG.info('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid') raise QnapDriverException(_('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid')) ''' # Below is to delete snapshot in the snapshot manager snap_metadata = self.get_snapshot_metadata(snapshot['id']) try: snapshot_id = snap_metadata['snapshot_id'] LOG.info(_LI('snapshot_id: %s'), snapshot_id) self.APIExecutor.deleteSnapshot(snapshot_id) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid')) # raise QnapDriverException(_LI('Metadata of the snapshot \ # is invalid')) def get_snapshot_metadata(self, snapshot_id): return self.db.snapshot_metadata_get(self.ctxt, snapshot_id) def create_volume_from_snapshot(self, volume, snapshot): """Create a volume from a snapshot.""" LOG.info(_LI('in create_volume_from_snapshot')) LOG.info(_LI('volume[display_name]: %s'), volume['display_name']) ''' # Below is to create a volume from a vss snapshot lun snap_metadata = self.get_snapshot_metadata(snapshot['id']) try:8 y9 SnapLUNNAA = snap_metadata['SnapLUNNAA'] ret = self.APIExecutor.createVssSnapshot(0, SnapLUNNAA) except Exception: LOG.info('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid') raise QnapDriverException(_('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid')) if (volume['size'] > snapshot['volume_size']): selectedLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNNAA = SnapLUNNAA) LUNIndex = selectedLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info('LUNIndex: %s ', LUNIndex) LUNName = selectedLun.find('LUNName').text LOG.info('LUNName: %s ', LUNName) self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex) ''' # Below is to clone a volume from a snapshot in the snapshot manager snap_metadata = self.get_snapshot_metadata(snapshot['id']) try: snapshot_id = snap_metadata['snapshot_id'] if volume['display_name'] is not None: self.APIExecutor.cloneSnapshot(snapshot_id, volume['display_name']) createdLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) else: new_volname = ('QCD-' + volume['name'][7:]. replace('-', ''))[0:31] self.APIExecutor.cloneSnapshot(snapshot_id, new_volname) createdLun = self.APIExecutor.getLunInfo(LUNName = new_volname) except Exception: LOG.info(_LI('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid')) raise QnapDriverException(_('Metadata of the snapshot is invalid')) LUNNAA = createdLun.find('LUNNAA').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNNAA: %s'), LUNNAA) _metadata = {'LUNNAA': LUNNAA} db.volume_metadata_update(self.ctxt, volume['id'], _metadata, False) if (volume['size'] > snapshot['volume_size']): selectedLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) LUNIndex = selectedLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) LUNName = selectedLun.find('LUNName').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNName: %s'), LUNName) # self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex) LUNThinAllocate = selectedLun.find('LUNThinAllocate').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNThinAllocate: %s'), LUNThinAllocate) self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, volume['size'], LUNIndex, LUNThinAllocate) def get_volume_stats(self, refresh=False): """Get volume stats. This is more of getting group stats.""" LOG.info(_LI('in get_volume_stats')) # IPList = self.APIExecutor.getAllEthernetIp(type = 'all') # LOG.info('IPList: %s', IPList) if refresh: backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('volume_backend_name')\ or self.__class__.__name__ LOG.info(_LI('backend_name=%(backend_name)s'), {'backend_name': backend_name}) selectedPool = self.APIExecutor.getSpecificPoolInfo(self. configuration. qnap_poolname) capacity_bytes = int(selectedPool.find('capacity_bytes').text) LOG.info(_LI('capacity_bytes: %s GB'), capacity_bytes / GB) freesize_bytes = int(selectedPool.find('freesize_bytes').text) LOG.info(_LI('freesize_bytes: %s GB'), freesize_bytes / GB) self.group_stats = {'volume_backend_name': backend_name, 'vendor_name': 'QNAP', 'driver_version': DRIVER_VERSION, 'storage_protocol': 'iSCSI', 'total_capacity_gb': capacity_bytes / GB, 'free_capacity_gb': freesize_bytes / GB, 'reserved_percentage': 0, 'QoS_support': False} return self.group_stats def extend_volume(self, volume, new_size): """Extend an existing volume.""" # volume_name = volume['name'] LOG.info(_LI('Entering extend_volume volume=%(vol)s ' 'new_size=%(size)s'), # {'vol': volume_name, 'size': new_size}) {'vol': volume['display_name'], 'size': new_size}) ''' vol_size = int(new_size) * units.Gi reserve = not self.configuration.san_thin_provision reserve_size = vol_size if reserve else 0 self.APIExecutor.edit_vol( volume_name, VOL_EDIT_MASK, # mask for vol attributes {'size': vol_size, 'reserve': reserve_size, 'warn-level': int(vol_size * WARN_LEVEL), 'quota': vol_size, 'snap-quota': vol_size}) ''' selectedLun = self.APIExecutor.\ getLunInfo(LUNName = volume['display_name']) LUNIndex = selectedLun.find('LUNIndex').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNIndex: %s'), LUNIndex) LUNName = selectedLun.find('LUNName').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNName: %s'), LUNName) LUNThinAllocate = selectedLun.find('LUNThinAllocate').text LOG.info(_LI('LUNThinAllocate: %s'), LUNThinAllocate) self.APIExecutor.editLun(LUNName, new_size, LUNIndex, LUNThinAllocate) def initialize_connection(self, volume, connector): """Create a target with initiator iqn to attach a volume.""" LOG.info(_LI('Entering initialize_connection volume=%(vol)s' ' connector=%(conn)s location=%(loc)s'), {'vol': volume, 'conn': connector, 'loc': volume['provider_location']}) # LOG.info(_LI('multipath support: %s'), connector['multipath']) selectedPool = self.APIExecutor.\ getPoolInfo(poolID = self.configuration.qnap_poolname) # LOG.info('selectedPool: %s ', ET.tostring(selectedPool)) # LOG.info('selectedPool pool_owner: %s ', # selectedPool.find('pool_owner').text) controllerName = selectedPool.find('pool_owner').text LOG.info(_LI('controllerName: %s'), controllerName) ret = self.APIExecutor.getIscsiPortalInfo() root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) iscsiPort = root.find('iSCSIPortal').find('servicePort').text LOG.info(_LI('iscsiPort: %s'), iscsiPort) targetIQNPrefix = root.find('iSCSIPortal').find('targetIQNPrefix').text LOG.info(_LI('targetIQNPrefix: %s'), targetIQNPrefix) targetIQNPostfix = root.find('iSCSIPortal').\ find('targetIQNPostfix').text LOG.info(_LI('targetIQNPostfix: %s'), targetIQNPostfix) LOG.info(_LI('volume[name]: %s'), volume['name']) LOG.info(_LI('volume[display_name]: %s'), volume['display_name']) if volume['display_name'] is not None: LUNIndex = self.APIExecutor.\ _getLunIDByLunname(LUNName=volume['display_name']) else: new_volname = ('QCD-' + volume['name'][7:].replace('-', ''))[0:31] LUNIndex = self.APIExecutor._getLunIDByLunname(LUNName=new_volname) LOG.info(_LI('aaa LUNIndex: %d'), LUNIndex) hostid, hostname = self.APIExecutor.\ getHostidListByInitIQN(connector['initiator']) if (len(hostid) == 0): LOG.info(_LI('hostid list is empty')) # target_name = "cinder-{0}".format(datetime.now(). # strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S%f')) target_name = "cinder-{0}".format(timeutils.utcnow(). strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S%f')) LOG.info(_LI('target_name: %s'), target_name) ret = self.APIExecutor.createTarget(target_name, controllerName) root = ET.fromstring(ret['data']) targetIndex = root.find('result').text LOG.info(_LI('targetIndex: %s'), targetIndex) initiator_name = connector['initiator'] self.APIExecutor.addTargetInit(targetIndex, initiator_name) target_iqn = targetIQNPrefix + target_name + targetIQNPostfix +\ ('.0' if controllerName == 'SCA' else '.1') else: LOG.info(_LI('hostid list is not empty')) targetid, targetiqn = self.APIExecutor.\ getTargetIdListByInitIQN(connector['initiator'], controllerName) if (len(targetid) == 0): LOG.info(_LI('targetid list is empty')) # ' Trying to relogin')) self.login() continue else: LOG.error(_LE('Re-throwing Exception %s'), e) raise return inner_connection_checker class QnapAPIExecutor(object): """Makes QNAP API calls.""" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): self.sid = None self.username = kwargs['username'] self.password = kwargs['password'] self.ip = kwargs['ip'] # self.port = kwargs['port'] self.port, self.ssl = self.getNasPortAndSsl(self.ip) self.login() def getNasPortAndSsl(self, host): LOG.info(_LI('in getNasPortAndSsl')) connection = http_client.HTTPConnection(host) connection.request('GET', '/cgi-bin/authLogin.cgi') response = connection.getresponse() data = response.read() LOG.info(_LI('response data: %s'), data) if response.status != 200: self._extract_http_error(data) root = ET.fromstring(data) QWebSSLEnabled = root.find('QWebSSLEnabled').text if QWebSSLEnabled == '1': port = root.find('QWebSSLPort').text ssl = True return port, ssl else: port = root.find('QWebPort').text ssl = False return port, ssl def _execute_and_get_response_details(self, host, url): """Will prepare response after executing an http request. commit_message:
Fix iscsi attach issues

Get udid when discovering the iscsi disk. Use this udid instead
of target_name for the PV's udid.

This change was necessary because the device will be referenced by
/dev/disk/by-id/<udid> instead of /dev/<device name>. Previously, the
udid (target_name) was selected by nova-powervm, now the udid will be
given to nova-powervm and reflect actual system values.

Change-Id: I48d133a97f64b05312e4572c3f0b35e57ea72ba6
Closes-Bug: 1643019

added_lines: mock_discover.return_value = '/dev/fake', 'fake_udid'

commit_message:
Add more tests to node_shell

Add a test to node_shell to verify that --network-interface argument
is passed to API correctly when calling node-create --network-interface
command.

Change-Id: Icde00d2563f601ce949a53b2cddf2e902d3e2d67

commit_message:
All handlers should be tagged "config"

This change adds the "*-config" tag to all handlers which is being done
so all of them can be skipped or included using the ansible tags syntax.
This is useful when running parts of the role, like when building image
based artifacts from the "*-install" tags.

Change-Id: I92d34b25c51d365e2f8b97b72a1aa08b1537ab79
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix return values in OneView deploy interface

This patch is about to add the return values of some methods in
the OneView drivers deploy interface and remove it when return
was not needed.

Change-Id: I700380fa85461eec506a953d2b2d823870b196bb
Closes-Bug: 1641162

subject: Reusing oneview_client when possible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 18:35:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/209880e7402424386a8623e5277924c9618653b6', 'message': '[WIP] Reusing oneview_client when possible

A simple experiment showed that all calls to OneView were calling for
authentication. Reviewing the code, I perceived that every single call to
python-oneviewclient were creating a new instance of the client, which
authenticated again and generated a new session token on OneView.

This patch aims to reuse oneview_client instances when possible, avoiding
to create unecessary new sessions that can be reused.

Change-Id: I0c26f0e033ca7f53f648c4ed29c6ef19f6f2e578
Closes-Bug: #1615070

commit_message:
Reusing oneview_client when possible

A simple experiment showed that all calls to OneView were calling for
authentication. Reviewing the code, I perceived that every single call to
python-oneviewclient were creating a new instance of the client, which
authenticated again and generated a new session token on OneView.

This patch aims to reuse oneview_client instances when possible, avoiding
to create unecessary new sessions that can be reused.

Co-Authored-By: Hugo Nicodemos <nicodemos@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Xavier <marcusrafael@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I0c26f0e033ca7f53f648c4ed29c6ef19f6f2e578
Closes-Bug: #1615070

commit_message:
Be explicit about not using ipv6 on rackspace

We can't use it until glean supports static ipv6 allocation on centos.

Change-Id: Ia9e3fb8dae68927c684096df558a410a2c41a967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/79/410879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Closes-Bug: #1623486
Change-Id: If303283949ef39a26c91bbff7b4664e81687d169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/60/404960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================== Uniform Airflow Migration Strategy ================================== Synopsis -------- **display name**: ``uniform_airflow`` **goal**: ``airflow_optimization`` Airflow (Unit: CFM) is a cooling related telemetry which can be used to measure the cooling status of server. This strategy makes decisions to migrate VMs to make the airflow uniform. Requirements ------------ This strategy has a dependency on the server having Intel's Power Node Manager 3.0 or later enabled. Metrics ******* The *uniform_airflow* strategy requires the following metrics: ================================== ============ ======= ======= metric service name plugins comment ================================== ============ ======= ======= ``hardware.ipmi.node.airflow`` ceilometer_ IPMI ``hardware.ipmi.node.temperature`` ceilometer_ IPMI ``hardware.ipmi.node.power`` ceilometer_ IPMI ================================== ============ ======= ======= .. _ceilometer: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/telemetry-measurements.html#ipmi-based-meters Cluster data model ****************** Default Watcher's Compute cluster data model: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.model.collector.nova.NovaClusterDataModelCollector Actions ******* Default Watcher's actions: .. list-table:: :widths: 30 30 :header-rows: 1 * - action - description * - ``migration`` - .. watcher-term:: watcher.applier.actions.migration.Migrate Planner ******* Default Watcher's planner: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.planner.default.DefaultPlanner Configuration ------------- Strategy parameters are: ====================== ====== ============= ===================================== parameter type default Value description ====================== ====== ============= ===================================== ``threshold_airflow`` Number 400.0 Airflow threshold for migration, Unit is 0.1CFM ``threshold_inlet_t`` Number 28.0 Inlet temperature threshold for migration decision ``threshold_power`` Number 350.0 System power threshold for migration decision ``period`` Number 300 System power threshold for migration decision ====================== ====== ============= ===================================== Efficacy Indicator ------------------ None Algorithm --------- For more information on the Uniform Airflow Migration Strategy please refer to: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/watcher-specs/specs/newton/implemented/uniform-airflow-migration-strategy.html How to use it ? --------------- .. code-block:: shell $ openstack optimize audittemplate create \ at1 airflow_optimization --strategy uniform_airflow $ openstack optimize audit create -a at1 -p threshold_airflow=410 \ -p threshold_inlet_t=29.0 -p threshold_power=355.0 -p period=310 External Links -------------- - `Intel Power Node Manager 3.0 <http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/power-management/intelligent-power-node-manager-3-0-specification.html>`_

added_lines: =================================== Workload Balance Migration Strategy =================================== Synopsis -------- **display name**: ``workload_balance`` **goal**: ``workload_balancing'' This strategy migrates a VM based on the VM workload of the hosts. It makes decision to migrate a workload whenever a host's CPU utilization % is higher than the specified threshold. The VM to be moved should make the host close to average workload of all hosts nodes. Requirements ------------ This strategy has a dependency on the host having Intel's Power Node Manager 3.0 or later enabled. Metrics ******* The *workload_balance* strategy requires the following metrics: ======================= ============ ======= ======= metric service name plugins comment ======================= ============ ======= ======= ``cpu_util`` ceilometer_ none ======================= ============ ======= ======= .. _ceilometer: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/telemetry-measurements.html#openstack-compute Cluster data model ****************** Default Watcher's Compute cluster data model: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.model.collector.nova.NovaClusterDataModelCollector Actions ******* Default Watcher's actions: .. list-table:: :widths: 30 30 :header-rows: 1 * - action - description * - ``migration`` - .. watcher-term:: watcher.applier.actions.migration.Migrate Planner ******* Default Watcher's planner: .. watcher-term:: watcher.decision_engine.planner.default.DefaultPlanner Configuration ------------- Strategy parameters are: ============== ====== ============= ==================================== parameter type default Value description ============== ====== ============= ==================================== ``threshold`` Number 25.0 Workload threshold for migration ``period`` Number 300 Aggregate time period of ceilometer ============== ====== ============= ==================================== Efficacy Indicator ------------------ None Algorithm --------- For more information on the Workload Balance Migration Strategy please refer to: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/watcher-specs/specs/mitaka/implemented/workload-balance-migration-strategy.html How to use it ? --------------- .. code-block:: shell $ openstack optimize audittemplate create \ at1 workload_balancing --strategy workload_balance $ openstack optimize audit create -a at1 -p threshold=26.0 \ -p period=310 External Links -------------- - `Intel Power Node Manager 3.0 <http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/power-management/intelligent-power-node-manager-3-0-specification.html>`_
